intro: Isopogon loudonii, commonly known as the red bottlebrush, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, bright red, brush-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with narrow, needle-like leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in coastal and sandy habitats. The flowers attract nectar-feeding birds and insects, making it an important component of local ecosystems.
